item.title: Delta Force Reveals New Operator for Upcoming Season
item.description:
Team Jade has unveiled a new Delta Force operator, Raptor, coming with the game's next season on September 23. Despite some drama over its single-player Black Hawk Down campaign in early 2025, it's been a solid year for the free-to-play shooter, especially over the past season. Now, Delta Force players can get excited about even more, with a new operator and fresh gameplay updates just around the corner.

The current Delta Force season, Break, arrived on July 9, a little over a month before the title made the jump to Xbox Series X/S and PlayStation 5. Break brought two new maps, an assault class operator, and three new weapons to the game, and that was before a major mid-season patch introduced even more content. With console players now joining the fun and PC player counts rising, Delta Force 's user base is bigger than ever and won't have to wait long for fresh updates.

New Recon Operator, Raptor, Is Coming to Delta Force on September 23

A September 7 video gave fans their first look at the new Recon class operator, Landon Harrison, also known as Raptor, who will arrive on September 23 with the new season, "War Ablaze." Raptor's gameplay centers around a drone, Silver Wing, which can mark all enemies in its field of view as well as act as a guided bomb if necessary. Raptor also carries an EMP grenade to disable nearby enemies' electronic equipment and has two tracking-centric traits. The first, Trace Tracker, reveals enemy players' recent footprints and information about the operators that left them behind, while the second, Trace Detection, warns players when an enemy is aiming at them. While Delta Force 's Recon class can be tricky to play, this gear makes the class even more useful and powerful than before.

In addition to the operator, Delta Force 's sixth season is introducing a new Warfare map, at least two new weapons, and a new vehicle, the F-45A Fighter Jet. When Season 4 of Delta Force came out in April, it introduced new difficulty modes and several new pieces of gear on top of the usual changes, so there could be more in store for the latest season, but fans will have to wait and see.

Team Jade has made some big changes to improve the game's multiplayer beyond adding new content. Between March 14 and March 20, Delta Force banned over 1,000 players for cheating, barring many of them for playing for over a decade. The devs have also promised major improvements to the console experience that will roll out over the next few updates and beyond.

Delta Force is back!

The iconic series returns as the definitive free-to-play modern team-based tactical shooter, and featuring three distinct gameplay modes:

- Warfare: battle the enemy across land, sea and air in truly epic 32 v 32 PvP combat, featuring a wide range of vehicles and unique tactical gear.

- Operations: Delta Force meets the next generation extraction shooter as you deploy behind enemy lines with your squad, search for valuables, take on rival players, and extract before it’s too late. Alternatively, our PvE Raid mode offers challenging objective-based missions designed to push your squad to the limit.

- Black Hawk Down: step into the boots of legendary Delta Force operators for this remake of the classic series campaign based on the gripping 2001 movie.

We are committed to NO PAY-TO-WIN and development is driven by community feedback. Fair play is a top priority, and our dedicated G.T.I. security anti-cheat team ensures a fair gameplay experience by proactively targeting and removing cheaters.

And remember…

“No-one gets left behind”

item.title: Silksong: How to Get Magnetite Dice
item.description:
Tools in Hollow Knight: Silksong can change the outcome of enemy encounters or challenging boss fights. Most of the tools in the game have really useful qualities that will come in handy in different situations. The Magnetite Dice is a Yellow Tool that players can acquire throughout the game, but the method of acquiring it may change depending on how far they have progressed in the story. The guide below offers information on the purpose of the Dice and how to easily obtain it in Hollow Knight: Silksong .

How to Get Magnetite Dice in Silksong

To get the Magnetite Dice , players must make their way to the Blasted Steps , which can be accessed after acquiring the Wall Jump ability in Shellwood and going to the top left part of the map. Once you reach the area, you need to go through the platforming section and make your way up to reach the Bellway Station . After interacting with the bench, head left and down to find a passage leading to Lumble the Lucky . You can talk to him, and he will ask you to play a game of dice with him. This game is purely random, and winning grants you 4 Rosaries, while a loss will set you back 4 Rosaries .

The key to winning the Tool is to play and win 40 Rosaries from Lumble . However, the catch is that you need to get 10 wins, but losses will set you back . Players can try out their luck and complete the game themselves, but given how it is purely reliant on luck, this can take up to an hour. Luckily, there is a way to cheese through this while also ensuring you win.

First, make sure you have rested at the nearby bench and play with Lumble until you have a 16-20 Rosaries lead. Once you have done that, simply Save and Quit, and you will be teleported back to the bench . Then, go back over to Lumble, and if you lose 3 times consecutively, quit the game without saving. This makes it so you will be back at that 16-20 Rosaries mark. Keep saving your progress once every 12 Rosaries gained, and you should get the Dice.

The second method to acquire the Dice involves completing the first Act and reaching the Coral Chambers inside the Citadel . You can then revisit Lumble the Lucky only to find him lying dead. You can interact with the item near him, which is the Dice.

What Does the Magnetite Dice Do in Silksong?

The Magnetite Dice 's description states that it is believed to bring luck to the wearer. Even though this description can be a little vague, equipping it and trying it in combat will give you some idea of what it does. The tool makes it so that there is a small chance that an attack that would hit and deal damage to you will not deal any damage .

You might think that this tool is overpowered, but the emphasis should be on the low chance. The chances of the effect triggering are very low. Even though it can sometimes save you in situations where you would be dead otherwise, you will not find it useful all the time. The tool is Yellow , and with how few offensive tools you have for that color, this is a must-equip for boss fights or enemy encounters.

item.title: 20 Best-Selling Dreamcast Games of All Time Revealed
item.description:
The top 20 best-selling Sega Dreamcast games of all time have recently been revealed – and unsurprisingly, Sonic Adventure , Crazy Taxi , and Sega Sports games dominated the top of the charts. From NFL and NBA games to SoulCalibur and Shenmue , these Dreamcast games made their mark as the most successful games on Sega’s final home console.

The Sega Dreamcast was released in North America on September 9, 1999, bringing the revolutionary console to a whole new audience. Though the popular retro gaming system garnered a significant cult following, it was unfortunately unable to compete with the PlayStation 2, which was released in March 2000, leading the console to discontinue support and production almost exactly a year after its rival’s launch, marking Sega’s withdrawal from the console war.

Top 20 Best-Selling Dreamcast Games (United States)

That said, the Dreamcast is still a beloved console, even 26 years after it was released. As a part of the celebration of the system’s anniversary, Circana senior director and video game industry thought leader Mat Piscatella shared a list on BlueSky revealing the top 20 Dreamcast games in the U.S. by dollars made and units sold. NFL 2K and NFL 2K1 made the most money, with Sonic Adventure close behind. However, Sonic Adventure actually sold the most units overall, with NFL 2K and Crazy Taxi in the second and third place positions.

20

Virtua Tennis

Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation

Overall, sports games dominate the list, with Sega Sports titles alone making up almost half of both charts. Beyond Sonic Adventure 1 and 2 and Crazy Taxi , fans can also find popular games like SoulCalibur , Shenmue , House of the Dead 2 , Resident Evil: Code: Veronica , and even Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation on these lists.

Piscatella shared this list due to popular demand after sharing similar ones for the 30th anniversary of the PlayStation’s release in North America, also on September 9. Call of Duty and Grand Theft Auto dominated the multi-console list, with well over half of the entries across the charts, though Minecraft claimed the second top-selling game by units across all PlayStation consoles, and Rockstar's Red Dead Redemption 2 made third on both. Interestingly enough, Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1 and 2 – both of which can be found on the Dreamcast list – also made the PlayStation 1-specific list, proving the popular skating simulator was a multi-platform success.

On August 29, Sega released Shinobi: Art of Vengeance to critical acclaim, and its upcoming Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds kart game is set to release on September 25. Sega may have bowed out of the console war almost 25 years ago, but the company is clearly still a big swinger in the video game industry.

item.title: Silksong: Where To Go After Shellwood?
item.description:
Shellwood is a forest-themed area in Hollow Knight: Silksong , where Hornet will learn one of the most crucial abilities for her journey in Pharloom. Because of that, this area is not skippable. However, once they have explored the region, players may wonder what to do or where to go after Shellwood in Silksong . This article will provide information about what must be done to progress with the main quest.

Where To Go After Shellwood In Silksong - Hollow Knight: Silksong

After players have explored Shellwood and gotten the Cling Grip skill in Silksong , Hornet needs to continue her journey to the Citadel. For that, if you wish to progress, you should:

  • Break the curse in Bellhart to get the Needolin skill in Silksong .
  • After getting the Needolin skill, continue west to the Blasted Steps region.

Rite of the Pollip is a side quest in Shellwood that grants an item that applies venom to equipped tools. Read here to find all Pollip Heart locations in Silksong .

Players can reach Blasted Steps from Bone Bottom, but if you're currently in Shellwood, there's an easier path from there. First, get close to the bench that connects Shellwood and Bone Bottom. However, before reaching the bench, look up to see a passage . Use your new wall jump ability to head up and unlock the bench right next to the Shellwood Bellway.

Next, run left, passing through the large open room, until there's a way to go up. Head up, and you should find a bench to rest on.

From the bench, go left and up until Hornet reaches the tall vertical room to the right.

Once you reach the vertical area, run to the room on the right to find Shakra and obtain the Blasted Steps map. You know you're in the right place when you start seeing Shakra's signature rings on the ground.

After getting the Blasted Steps map, you must climb up the vertical area until you find Blasted Steps' Bellway. You can do this by going up from the room where you found Shakra, or exit the room and go up from there. Both will lead to the same place.

Rest up and unlock the fast travel point, then continue your journey to the east, where you'll eventually reach the Grand Gate.

Here, Hornet must use her Needolin to proceed; that's why it's mandatory to first unlock the ability. Additionally, a boss fight with the Last Judge in Silksong will also begin, further emphasizing the need to unlock the nearest bench to the Grand Gate.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Fans Have a New Clown Meme Target
item.description:
Team Cherry's long-awaited Metroidvania, Hollow Knight: Silksong , is finally available on all platforms, and so far, it seems like it's living up to the hype. While there aren't a lot of professional reviews available for the game at the moment, Hollow Knight: Silksong currently has an astounding 95/100 Top Critic Average on OpenCritic, with 100% of critics recommending the game. The game's Steam user ratings are largely positive, as well, and despite some recurring complaints about its immense difficulty, it has managed to earn a 91% positive score on the site. As great as all of this is, though, the path to the game's launch has been anything but an easy one .

Hollow Knight: Silksong was originally announced with a brief trailer in 2019, but the game infamously went MIA for years. Aside from showing a few trailers off here and there, Team Cherry provided very few updates on the game’s development. T his led many fans to make clown memes about Hollow Knight: Silksong , which they used to make fun of themselves and each other for falsely believing that the game would appear at a showcase, even though it almost never did. Now that Silksong is out, the clown memes for the game are pretty much dead, but there is still one other upcoming title that fans can meme about.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Could Become the New Silksong for the Next Few Weeks

If there's one game that rivals Hollow Knight: Silksong in terms of having a ridiculously long gap between its announcement and release, it's probably Metroid Prime 4: Beyond . This Nintendo-exclusive title was actually revealed two years prior to Silksong , but to this day, it still hasn't hit store shelves. When Metroid Prime 4 was first shown off at Nintendo's E3 2017 press conference, the game was quite literally nothing but a logo at the time. Nintendo said that the title would be developed by some of Bandai Namco's studios in Japan and Singapore, but it ultimately didn't end up that way.

I n 2019, Nintendo revealed that it had restarted Metroid Prime 4' s development, after the initial version of the game made by Bandai Namco failed to meet its internal expectations. The company said that it decided to hand the game off to Retro Studios, the original developers of the Metroid Prime franchise. At the time, Retro Studios was working on an all-new platformer for the Nintendo Switch called Harmony , but this unannounced project was canceled in order to prioritize Metroid Prime 4 's development.

Retro Studios hasn't released a new game since 2014's Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze, its only other release since then being Metroid Prime Remastered in 2023.

After All These Years, Metroid Prime 4 Still Doesn't Have a Proper Release Date

Nintendo didn't release a single trailer for Metroid Prime 4 until June 2024, when it confirmed that the game would be released on the Nintendo Switch sometime in 2025. The company then announced earlier this year that the game would get a port for the Nintendo Switch 2, featuring enhanced visuals and smoother frame rates. Despite the fact that Nintendo has shown Metroid Prime 4 off multiple times in the last few months, it has remained oddly tight-lipped about the game's release date.

The Rumored Nintendo Direct this Month Could Feature Metroid Prime 4 in Some Capacity

While it's unlikely that Metroid Prime 4 will get hit by a major delay, similar to the one that Hollow Knight: Silksong suffered from back in 2022, there's still a chance that the game could get pushed back into early 2026. Regardless of how things play out, recent rumors have suggested that a Nintendo Direct is going to take place this September. Even though nothing has been officially confirmed yet, it seems likely that Metroid Prime 4 would appear at such an event in some capacity. If it doesn't, however, then it wouldn't be surprising if fans started to post tons of clown memes for the game on social media, just like they did with Hollow Knight: Silksong .
